result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine of $600.00; All court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution in the amount of $0.

CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS ELIGIBLE for the WI Substance Abuse program after 1.5 years of initial confinement has been served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- Obtain a GED/HSED.

- No Contact with the drug community.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

- Cognitive behavioral therapy.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA and mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Daniel Koehn

Per remittitur dated May 3, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP001552 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on March 22, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Kiley Zellner is withdrawn as counsel for the appellant.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this appeal is dismissed without prejudice.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to sixty days from the date of this order.

records.addlTxt: Jury Questions

Defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.  State informed the court that there was no victim on this case.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 33 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2.5 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS ELIGIBLE for the WI Substance Abuse program after 1.5 years of initial confinement has been served.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA and mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No contact with the drug community
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment.
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- cognitive behavorial therapy
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00; 
Restitution in the amount of $0; 
All court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Any Cash bail on deposit to be applied.)  
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  
Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  3 years  thereafter.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

On the same day, at the hour of 10:10 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, James B, brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Operating while intoxicated, as charged in the Information.  Dated this 15th day of July, 2016.  James B, Foreperson."

On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury at 10:13 am.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Deliberations continue.   Sheriff's Deputy Mooney duly sworn for that purpose, deputy Leranth previously sworn.

Defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:42 pm.  Continued sworn testimony from toxicologist Leah Macans.  Exhibits # 1-9 offered and received.   Exhibits # 1-3 published to the jury.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 1:53 pm.   Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.   Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to remain silent and is going to testify.  Jury in box at 1:59 pm.   Sworn for defense: Christopher D. Koehn.  Sidebar.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: West Allis Police Officer Bernie Molthen.  Sidebar.   Jury out of box at 2:41 pm.  Sidebars put on the record.   Jury in box at 2:52 pm.  Continued sworn testimony from West Allis Police Officer Bernie Molthen.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 2:57 pm.   Jury in box at 3:24 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Sidebar.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:12 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Leranth and D'Amato who were duly sworn for that purpose.   Sidebar put on the record.   Jury in box at 4:46 pm.  Jury out of box at 4:47 pm.  Court recessed for the day.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 9:05 am.  Sworn for the state:  James W., West Allis Police Officer Ramon Agor, West Allis Police Officer Bernie Molthen.  Sidebar.  Jury out of box at 9:48 am.  Sidebar put on the record.  Jury in box at 10:01 am.   Continued sworn testimony from West Allis Police Officer Bernie Molthen.  Sworn for the state:  Toxicologist Leah Macans.  Jury out of box at 11:29 am.  Jury in box at 11:41 am.  Continued sworn testimony from Toxicologist Leah Macans.  Jury out of box at 11:59 am.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Christopher Daniel Koehn in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury panel in court in court at 1:58 pm.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:14 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury out of box at 3:34 pm.  Jury in box at 4:19 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Sworn for defense: Nicole S, West Allis Police Officer Steven Kuhnmuench.  Jury out of box at 4:53 pm.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
